headline: Honey Walnut Shrimp (蜜汁合桃虾)
description: Learn how to make this classic Chinese banquet (and takeout) dish at home!

recipeInstructions.name: Prepare shrimp
recipeInstructions.text: Assuming you're starting with peeled, deveined shrimp (which is what my dad recommends), cut each shrimp in half lengthwise. This will help result in a more beautiful, crunchy fry.

recipeInstructions.name: Prepare sauce
recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, we'll mix mayonnaise, sweetened condensed milk, and lemon juice.

recipeInstructions.name: Prepare batter
recipeInstructions.text: In a bowl, we'll beat our egg(s).

recipeInstructions.name: Prepare sugar syrup (optional)
recipeInstructions.text: If you don't have honey, or don't want to use honey for whatever reason, you can go with the restaurant route.

recipeInstructions.name: Heat oil, fry walnuts
recipeInstructions.text: We'll fill a pan or wok with enough oil to submerge the walnuts, and heat it to around 300F.

recipeInstructions.name: Heat oil, fry shrimp
recipeInstructions.text: Read before you start frying shrimp

recipeInstructions.name: Plate and garnish
recipeInstructions.text: Mix and coat the shrimp with the sauce from earlier, and add the candied walnuts and sesame seeds.

video.name: Honey Walnut Shrimp (蜜汁合桃虾)
video.description: Learn how to make this classic Chinese banquet (and takeout) dish at home!
